titleStmt.title: The English rogue described, in the life of Meriton Latroon, a witty extravagant Being a compleat discovery of the most eminent cheats of both sexes. Licensed, January 5. 1666.
English rogue. Part 1
titleStmt.author: Head, Richard, 1637?-1686?

publicationStmt.publisher: printed for Francis Kirkman, and are to be sold by him and Thomas Dring the younger, at the White-Lyon next Chancery-lane in Fleet street,

notesStmt.note: By Richard Head, who signs the epistle to the reader.
Running title reads: The English rogue: or, witty extravagant.
Part I only of a work of fiction based upon the author's early life.
Text continuous, in spite of the erratic pagination.
Reproduction of the original at the Bodleian Library, Oxford, England.

place.placeName: the White-Lyon next Chancery-lane in Fleet street
